title: Not syncing blocks, stuck on 2/15 Headers stage and not updating rpc last block
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `./erigon --version`

erigon version 2.43.0-stable-1106475e

OS & Version: Windows/Linux/OSX

Linux

Commit hash: 

1106475e345d936aa1220ace3e95d746ec361fa4

Erigon Command (with flags/config):

./build/bin/erigon --datadir mainnet    --txpool.api.addr=erigon:9090 --internalcl  

Concensus Layer:

internal 

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config):

Chain/Network: 
ethereum mainnet
 
#### Expected behaviour

get last block synced when request to rpc 


#### Actual behaviour

it takes more than one day to update last block when requesting to rpc. Sync process is stuck on   2/15 Headers stage, and after 24h or more process bodies,  and update value when request to rpc. 

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

curl -X POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" --data '{"jsonrpc": "2.0", "method": "eth_blockNumber", "params": [], "id":1}' localhost:8545

it's feature. blocks will be available after execution/indexing/etc... after pass all stages: `[5/15 Bodies]`

So it's not possible to access the blocks via rpc every 10 seconds, i.e. how are they created on the mainnet? it never manages to sync up with the last block. In a few days it reached 17.5 M blocks but after 2 weeks it doesn't get to synchronize with the last block, always 1 or 2 thousand blocks behind.

`it doesn't get to synchronize with the last block`: probably you using high-latency disk
show logs (especially Timings and Commit lines)
tell about hardware type

then maybe can give some recommendations

32GB memory
